summary: The implementation addresses all four requirements with comprehensive error handling, ErrorBoundary components, improved authentication flow, and graceful fallbacks for incomplete backend methods. The diff shows proper diagnosis and fixes for game loading issues through error boundaries, enhanced store initialization with error recovery, proper GameScene rendering checks, and improved backend actor initialization with authorization.

hallucinated_features.description: Complete ErrorBoundary component with custom fallback UI, reload functionality, and AlertCircle icon
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-1 requires fixing critical errors preventing game loading, but does not specify implementing a custom ErrorBoundary component with UI fallback. The requirement focuses on diagnosing and fixing the error, not adding error boundary infrastructure.

hallucinated_features.description: Mock data fallbacks in useQueries hooks for sectors, products, funds, and reputation with console.warn logging
hallucinated_features.reason: While REQ-4 addresses backend initialization issues, the requirement doesn't explicitly request implementing mock data fallback systems. The specification asks to fix backend issues, not to add placeholder/mock data systems.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend actor access control system with admin permissions and user role checks
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest mentions preserving user authentication flow as a constraint, not a requirement. The extensive access control system with admin/user roles goes beyond fixing authentication issues specified in REQ-4.
